comment: The imaginary unit is the square root of negative 1. A lot of people like to call this the "definition" of ` _i ` , but the definition of ` sqrt ` ~ df-sqrt has already been crafted with ` _i ` being mentioned explicitly, and in any case it doesn't make too much sense to define a value based on a function evaluated outside its domain. A more appropriate view is to take ~ ax-i2m1 or ~ i2 as the "definition", and simply postulate the existence of a number satisfying this property. This is the approach we take here. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Jul-2013.)
